overview.description: Key events in African American and diaspora history from 1619 to present.

events.title: First Africans Arrive in Virginia
events.description: The first recorded Africans arrive in the English colonies at Point Comfort, Virginia, marking the beginning of slavery in British North America.

events.title: Fugitive Slave Act
events.description: Congress passes the Fugitive Slave Act, requiring the return of escaped enslaved people.

events.title: Haiti Declares Independence
events.description: Haiti becomes the first free Black republic after a successful slave revolution led by Toussaint Louverture.

events.title: Nat Turner's Rebellion
events.description: Nat Turner leads one of the most significant slave rebellions in American history in Virginia.

events.title: Harriet Tubman Escapes Slavery
events.description: Harriet Tubman escapes slavery and later becomes a conductor on the Underground Railroad.

events.title: Emancipation Proclamation
events.description: President Lincoln issues the Emancipation Proclamation, freeing enslaved people in Confederate states.

events.title: 13th Amendment Ratified
events.description: The 13th Amendment abolishes slavery throughout the United States.

events.title: 14th Amendment Ratified
events.description: The 14th Amendment grants citizenship and equal protection under the law.

events.title: 15th Amendment Ratified
events.description: The 15th Amendment prohibits denying the right to vote based on race.

events.title: NAACP Founded
events.description: The National Association for the Advancement of Colored People is founded in New York.

events.title: Great Migration Begins
events.description: Millions of African Americans begin migrating from the rural South to Northern cities.

events.title: Negro National League Founded
events.description: The Negro National League, a professional Black baseball league, is founded.

events.title: Harlem Renaissance Peak
events.description: The Harlem Renaissance flourishes with artists like Langston Hughes, Zora Neale Hurston, and Duke Ellington.

events.title: Jesse Owens Wins 4 Gold Medals
events.description: Jesse Owens wins four gold medals at the Berlin Olympics, defying Nazi ideology.

events.title: Jackie Robinson Breaks Baseball Color Barrier
events.description: Jackie Robinson becomes the first African American to play in Major League Baseball.

events.title: HMT Empire Windrush Arrives
events.description: The HMT Empire Windrush brings Caribbean migrants to the UK, beginning the Windrush generation.

events.title: Brown v. Board of Education
events.description: Supreme Court rules school segregation unconstitutional, overturning 'separate but equal'.

events.title: Montgomery Bus Boycott
events.description: Rosa Parks' arrest sparks the Montgomery Bus Boycott, led by Martin Luther King Jr.

events.title: Ghana Gains Independence
events.description: Ghana becomes the first sub-Saharan African country to gain independence from colonial rule.

events.title: March on Washington
events.description: 250,000 people attend the March on Washington where MLK delivers 'I Have a Dream' speech.

events.title: Civil Rights Act Passed
events.description: President Johnson signs the Civil Rights Act, outlawing discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, or national origin.

events.title: Voting Rights Act Passed
events.description: The Voting Rights Act prohibits racial discrimination in voting.

events.title: Black Panther Party Founded
events.description: Huey Newton and Bobby Seale found the Black Panther Party in Oakland, California.

events.title: Loving v. Virginia
events.description: Supreme Court strikes down laws banning interracial marriage.

events.title: Martin Luther King Jr. Assassinated
events.description: Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. is assassinated in Memphis, Tennessee.

events.title: Roots Airs on Television
events.description: The miniseries 'Roots' airs, becoming one of the most-watched television events in history.

events.title: MLK Day Becomes Federal Holiday
events.description: President Reagan signs legislation making Martin Luther King Jr. Day a federal holiday.

events.title: The Oprah Winfrey Show Premieres
events.description: The Oprah Winfrey Show begins national syndication, becoming the highest-rated talk show.

events.title: LA Riots
events.description: The acquittal of officers in the Rodney King beating sparks widespread civil unrest.

events.title: Nelson Mandela Elected President
events.description: Nelson Mandela becomes South Africa's first Black president after the end of apartheid.

events.title: Barack Obama Elected President
events.description: Barack Obama becomes the first African American President of the United States.

events.title: Trayvon Martin Shooting
events.description: The shooting of Trayvon Martin leads to the founding of Black Lives Matter movement.

events.title: Black Lives Matter Founded
events.description: Alicia Garza, Patrisse Cullors, and Opal Tometi found the Black Lives Matter movement.

events.title: NMAAHC Opens
events.description: The National Museum of African American History and Culture opens on the National Mall.

events.title: Black Panther Released
events.description: Marvel's Black Panther becomes a cultural phenomenon, grossing $1.3 billion worldwide.

events.title: George Floyd Protests
events.description: The murder of George Floyd sparks worldwide protests against police brutality.

events.title: Kamala Harris Elected VP
events.description: Kamala Harris becomes the first Black and South Asian American Vice President.

events.title: Ketanji Brown Jackson Confirmed
events.description: Ketanji Brown Jackson becomes the first Black woman on the Supreme Court.

events.title: Warnock Wins Full Term
events.description: Raphael Warnock wins a full Senate term, the first Black senator elected in Georgia.
